Articles.Content: Do these still exist? It seems to me all the batteries have mass added to the craft weight. Or do they add weight to the totals but are not calculated in the physics?

IIRC the old "massless" parts now add their listed mass to the parent object. Helpful to avoid off-centred masses because you put a battery pack on one side, for example ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
That explains so much ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I always wondered why assemtric batteries didnt cause tipping
Pedantic correction: Physicsless parts add their mass to the first non-physicsless parent. So a radial battery attached to a cubic octagonal strut attached to a tank would add its mass to the tank.
